sentences.chinese: 太史公讀秦記，至犬戎敗幽王，周東徙洛邑，秦襄公始封為諸侯，作西畤用事上帝，僭端見矣。
sentences.literal: When the Grand Historian read the Qin records, reaching the point where the Quanrong defeated King You and Zhou moved east to Luoyi, Duke Xiang of Qin was first enfeoffed as a feudal lord, built the Western Altar to serve the Supreme Deity—the first signs of presumption appeared.

sentences.chinese: 《禮》曰：「天子祭天地，諸侯祭其域內名山大川。」
sentences.literal: The Rites say: 'The Son of Heaven sacrifices to Heaven and Earth, feudal lords sacrifice to the famous mountains and great rivers within their domains.'

sentences.chinese: 今秦雜戎翟之俗，先暴戾，後仁義，位在藩臣而臚於郊祀，君子懼焉。
sentences.literal: Now Qin mixed the customs of the Rong and Di, putting violence and tyranny first, benevolence and righteousness after. Though positioned as a vassal minister, they performed suburban sacrifices—the gentlemen were alarmed.

sentences.chinese: 及文公踰隴，攘夷狄，尊陳寶，營岐雍之閒，而穆公修政，東竟至河，則與齊桓、晉文中國侯伯侔矣。
sentences.literal: When Duke Wen crossed the Long mountains, drove back the Yi and Di barbarians, honored Chen Bao, and camped between Qi and Yong, Duke Mu repaired his government, his eastern border reached the Yellow River, and thus he equaled the central states' feudal lords like Duke Huan of Qi and Duke Wen of Jin.

sentences.chinese: 是後陪臣執政，大夫世祿，六卿擅晉權，征伐會盟，威重於諸侯。
sentences.literal: After this, attendants took charge of government, grand officers held hereditary stipends, the six ministers monopolized Jin's power, conducting campaigns and alliances, their authority greater than the feudal lords.

sentences.chinese: 及田常殺簡公而相齊國，諸侯晏然弗討，海內爭於戰功矣。
sentences.literal: When Tian Chang killed Duke Jian and became chancellor of Qi, the feudal lords were complacently undisturbed, all under Heaven contended for military achievements. (translated).

sentences.chinese: 三國終之卒分晉，田和亦滅齊而有之，六國之盛自此始。
sentences.literal: The three states finally divided Jin, Tian He also extinguished Qi and possessed it—the flourishing of the six states began from this time.

sentences.chinese: 務在彊兵并敵，謀詐用而從衡短長之說起。
sentences.literal: Their efforts were devoted to strengthening troops and uniting against enemies, and the sayings of scheming, deception, and the vertical and horizontal alliances of long and short arose from this. (translated).

sentences.chinese: 矯稱蜂出，誓盟不信，雖置質剖符猶不能約束也。
sentences.literal: False pretenses swarmed like bees, oaths and covenants were not trusted, even placing hostages and splitting tallies could not bind them. (translated).

sentences.chinese: 秦始小國僻遠，諸夏賓之，比於戎翟，至獻公之後常雄諸侯。
sentences.literal: Qin began as a small, remote country, the various Xia treated it as a guest, compared it to the Rong and Di, until after Duke Xian it constantly dominated the feudal lords. (translated).

sentences.chinese: 論秦之德義不如魯衛之暴戾者，量秦之兵不如三晉之彊也，然卒并天下，非必險固便形勢利也，蓋若天所助焉。
sentences.literal: Discussing Qin's virtue and righteousness as inferior to the violent tyranny of Lu and Wei, measuring Qin's troops as not as strong as the three Jins, yet in the end it united all under Heaven—not necessarily because of dangerous fortifications, convenient terrain, or advantageous positions, but rather as if Heaven assisted it.

sentences.chinese: 或曰「東方物所始生，西方物之成孰」。
sentences.literal: Some say 'Eastern things begin life there, western things mature there.'

sentences.chinese: 夫作事者必於東南，收功實者常於西北。
sentences.literal: Those who initiate affairs must do so in the southeast, those who gather actual merit are constantly in the northwest. (translated).

sentences.chinese: 故禹興於西羌，湯起於亳，周之王也以豐鎬伐殷，秦之帝用雍州興，漢之興自蜀漢。
sentences.literal: Thus Yu rose from the Western Qiang, Tang arose from Bo, Zhou's kings used Feng and Hao to attack Yin, Qin's emperors used Yong province to rise, Han's rise came from Shu and Han.

sentences.chinese: 秦既得意，燒天下詩書，諸侯史記尤甚，為其有所刺譏也。
sentences.literal: Qin, having achieved its ambitions, burned the poems and documents of all under Heaven, the feudal lords' historical records especially so, because they contained criticisms.
